translated: Verses of the Elders
The Collection of Forty-One
The First Chapter
Mahākassapa
Do not go about with a crowd in front,
for concentration is difficult to attain without seclusion.
It is painful to associate with many people,
seeing this, do not delight in a crowd.
The sage should not visit families,
for concentration is difficult to attain without seclusion.
He who is eager, greedy for tastes,
neglects the goal that brings happiness.
